meanings.definition: Send the same message indiscriminately to (a large number of recipients) over the Internet.
meanings.sent1: He spammed his friends with the same joke over and over.
meanings.sent2: The company spammed my inbox with promotional emails.
meanings.sent3: The robot thought it was funny to spam the same question repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter spammed the room, contagious and loud.
meanings.sent5: The rain spammed down on the roof, a steady drumbeat of sound.

meanings.definition: Unsolicited electronic messages, typically advertising, sent in bulk.
meanings.sent1: I received so much spam in my email inbox.
meanings.sent2: The spam filled up my junk folder quickly.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the spam emails were treats and tried to eat them.
meanings.sent4: The spam was like a swarm of annoying insects buzzing around.
meanings.sent5: The spam was a never-ending stream of unwanted messages.
